item.title: Compromises in Democrats' climate bill will hit communities facing most pollution hardest, critics say
item.description: Critics question whether the Inflation Reduction Act will help people of color and low-income communities as much as intended.
item.author: USA TODAY
item.dc:creator: Bill Keveney, USA TODAY
item.content:encoded: Critics question whether the Inflation Reduction Act will help people of color and low-income communities as much as intended.

item.title: Rescued baby dolphin nursed to health
item.description: An injured baby dolphin, found almost drowning on the eastern coast of Thailand, is making vast improvements thanks to a team of volunteers (Aug 27)
item.author: AP Domestic
item.dc:creator: AP
item.content:encoded: An injured baby dolphin, found almost drowning on the eastern coast of Thailand, is making vast improvements thanks to a team of volunteers (Aug 27)

item.title: Fed symposium closes, Little League World Series, MTV VMAs: 5 things to know this weekend
item.description: The Federal Reserve's symposium wraps up, the Little League World Series is set to crown a new champ and more news to start your weekend.
item.author: USA TODAY
item.dc:creator: Editors
item.content:encoded: The Federal Reserve's symposium wraps up, the Little League World Series is set to crown a new champ and more news to start your weekend.

item.title: Concert goers thought the man might carry out a mass shooting. Police now say it was something else.
item.description: Police accused a Washington man of plotting a mass shooting at a concert. The truth may be more benign but concert goers' concerns were real.
item.author: USA TODAY
item.dc:creator: Amanda PÃ©rez Pintado, USA TODAY
item.content:encoded: Police accused a Washington man of plotting a mass shooting at a concert. The truth may be more benign but concert goers' concerns were real.

item.title: Colorado Democrats pitch 'ideal candidate' for President Joe Biden's first national monument
item.description: Camp Hale-Continental Divide National Monument, if created, would be the nation's 130th protected area but first since Kentucky's Camp Nelson in 2018.
item.author: USA TODAY
item.dc:creator: Steve Kiggins, USA TODAY
item.content:encoded: Camp Hale-Continental Divide National Monument, if created, would be the nation's 130th protected area but first since Kentucky's Camp Nelson in 2018.

item.title: CDC chief 'cautiously optimistic' on monkeypox
item.description: The director of the CDC is expressing 'cautious optimism' in the fight against monkeypox, saying health officials in some areas are seeing "a downward trend." (Aug. 26)
item.author: AP Domestic
item.dc:creator: AP
item.content:encoded: The director of the CDC is expressing 'cautious optimism' in the fight against monkeypox, saying health officials in some areas are seeing "a downward trend." (Aug. 26)

item.title: Today in History for August 27th
item.description: Highlights of this day in history: Krakatoa erupts in South Pacific; President Lyndon Johnson and Mother Teresa born; America's first successful oil well; Britain's Lord Louis Mountbatten killed; Beatles manager Brian Epstein dies. (Aug. 27)
item.author: AP Domestic
item.dc:creator: AP
item.content:encoded: Highlights of this day in history: Krakatoa erupts in South Pacific; President Lyndon Johnson and Mother Teresa born; America's first successful oil well; Britain's Lord Louis Mountbatten killed; Beatles manager Brian Epstein dies. (Aug. 27)

item.title: U.S. Gulf coast powers NASA's new moon rocket
item.description: NASA's new moon rocket makes its debut next week. The Space Launch System is shorter and slimmer than the Saturn V rockets that hurled Apollo astronauts to the moon. But it's mightier, packing 8.8 million pounds of thrust. (Aug. 26) (AP Video by Stephen Smith)
item.author: AP Domestic
item.dc:creator: AP
item.content:encoded: NASA's new moon rocket makes its debut next week. The Space Launch System is shorter and slimmer than the Saturn V rockets that hurled Apollo astronauts to the moon. But it's mightier, packing 8.8 million pounds of thrust. (Aug. 26) (AP Video by Stephen Smith)

item.title: Riga city council vote leads to fall of Soviet-era World War II monument in Latvia
item.description: A Soviet-era, World War II monument was destroyed months after Russia's invasion of Ukraine after Riga's city council voted to remove the monument.
item.author: USA TODAY
item.dc:creator: Ariana Triggs, USA TODAY
item.content:encoded: A Soviet-era, World War II monument was destroyed months after Russia's invasion of Ukraine after Riga's city council voted to remove the monument.

item.title: Woman denied abortion wants Louisiana ban clearer
item.description: A pregnant Louisiana woman, who was denied an abortion despite her fetus having a rare and fatal condition, demanded on Friday that Gov. John Bel Edwards and the legislature call a special session to rewrite and clarify the state's abortion laws. (Aug. 26)
item.author: AP Domestic
item.dc:creator: AP
item.content:encoded: A pregnant Louisiana woman, who was denied an abortion despite her fetus having a rare and fatal condition, demanded on Friday that Gov. John Bel Edwards and the legislature call a special session to rewrite and clarify the state's abortion laws. (Aug. 26)

item.title: Flooding fears lead to move-out in Mississippi
item.description: People in central Mississippi are preparing for anticipated flooding of rivers and creeks (Aug.26) (AP video: Emily Wagster Pettus)
item.author: AP Domestic
item.dc:creator: AP
item.content:encoded: People in central Mississippi are preparing for anticipated flooding of rivers and creeks (Aug.26) (AP video: Emily Wagster Pettus)

item.title: Police rescue men after boat sinks off Boston
item.description: In the nick of time, the Boston Police Department's harbor patrol unit rescued a father and son who were desperately clinging to a cooler at the outermost edge of Boston Harbor after their lobster boat sank. (Aug. 26)
item.author: AP Domestic
item.dc:creator: AP
item.content:encoded: In the nick of time, the Boston Police Department's harbor patrol unit rescued a father and son who were desperately clinging to a cooler at the outermost edge of Boston Harbor after their lobster boat sank. (Aug. 26)

item.title: 5-year-old left in vehicle outside school becomes 18th hot car death this year
item.description: At least 18 kids have died in hot cars in the U.S. this year. USA TODAY details each case, how they happened and what can help prevent such deaths.
item.author: USA TODAY
item.dc:creator: Amanda Lee Myers, USA TODAY
item.content:encoded: At least 18 kids have died in hot cars in the U.S. this year. USA TODAY details each case, how they happened and what can help prevent such deaths.

item.description: A look at the day's best photographs from around the world.
item.author: USA TODAY
item.dc:creator: USA TODAY
item.content:encoded: A look at the day's best photographs from around the world.

item.title: AP Top Stories
item.description: Here's the latest for Friday, August 26: DOJ releases affidavit for FBI Trump estate search; Fed Chair Powell warns of future rate hikes; Scores rescued in Philippine ferry fire; French vineyards start harvest early over drought.
item.author: AP Domestic
item.dc:creator: AP
item.content:encoded: Here's the latest for Friday, August 26: DOJ releases affidavit for FBI Trump estate search; Fed Chair Powell warns of future rate hikes; Scores rescued in Philippine ferry fire; French vineyards start harvest early over drought.

item.title: Texas can't ban adults under 21 from carrying handguns, judge rules
item.description: A federal judge said the Second Amendment barred Texas from prohibiting 18- to 20-year-olds from carrying a handgun.
item.author: Austin American-Statesman
item.dc:creator: Chuck Lindell, Austin American-Statesman
item.content:encoded: A federal judge said the Second Amendment barred Texas from prohibiting 18- to 20-year-olds from carrying a handgun.

item.title: Affidavit released for FBI search of Trump estate
item.description: An FBI affidavit, heavily redacted to protect the safety of witnesses, law enforcement officials and "the ongoing investigation," offers the most detailed description to date of classified records being stored at Trump's Mar-a-Lago estate. (Aug. 26)
item.author: AP Domestic
item.dc:creator: AP
item.content:encoded: An FBI affidavit, heavily redacted to protect the safety of witnesses, law enforcement officials and "the ongoing investigation," offers the most detailed description to date of classified records being stored at Trump's Mar-a-Lago estate. (Aug. 26)

item.title: Black pastor suing police department for unlawful arrest while watering neighbor's flowers
item.description: Pastor Michael Jennings is suing an Alabama police department after he said he was unlawfully arrested while watering his neighbor's flowers.
item.author: USA TODAY
item.dc:creator: Ariana Triggs, USA TODAY
item.content:encoded: Pastor Michael Jennings is suing an Alabama police department after he said he was unlawfully arrested while watering his neighbor's flowers.

item.title: Trudeau, Stoltenberg tout unity in Arctic defense
item.description: Canadian Prime Minister Justin Trudeau and NATO Secretary General Jens Stoltenberg wrapped up a two day visit to Canada's Far North by touting NATO's role in defending the Arctic region. (Aug. 26)
item.author: AP Domestic
item.dc:creator: AP
item.content:encoded: Canadian Prime Minister Justin Trudeau and NATO Secretary General Jens Stoltenberg wrapped up a two day visit to Canada's Far North by touting NATO's role in defending the Arctic region. (Aug. 26)

item.title: A Michigan town may lose its only library after its staff refused to remove an LGBTQ book
item.description: The Patmos Library in Jamestown, Michigan, may close after residents voted to defund it over staff's refusal to remove books with LGBT themes.
item.author: Detroit Free Press
item.dc:creator: Emma Stein, Detroit Free Press
item.content:encoded: The Patmos Library in Jamestown, Michigan, may close after residents voted to defund it over staff's refusal to remove books with LGBT themes.

item.author: AP Domestic
item.dc:creator: AP
item.content:encoded: NASA astronaut Stan Love discusses upcomiing Artemis moon mission and beyond. (Aug. 26)

item.title: Biden reacts to Trump's claim he declassified docs
item.description: President Joe Biden responds to Donald Trump's taking of top secret documents to his Florida Mar-a-Lago estate and appears to mock the former president's assertion that he declassified the documents seized by the FBI earlier this month. (Aug. 26)
item.author: AP Domestic
item.dc:creator: AP
item.content:encoded: President Joe Biden responds to Donald Trump's taking of top secret documents to his Florida Mar-a-Lago estate and appears to mock the former president's assertion that he declassified the documents seized by the FBI earlier this month. (Aug. 26)

item.title: Former Arizona police officer charged with manslaughter in fatal shooting of man in wheelchair
item.description: Former Tucson police Officer Ryan Remington fatally shot Richard Lee Richards, a man in a motorized wheelchair who was suspected of shoplifting.
item.author: Arizona Republic
item.dc:creator: Sam Burdette, Arizona Republic
item.content:encoded: Former Tucson police Officer Ryan Remington fatally shot Richard Lee Richards, a man in a motorized wheelchair who was suspected of shoplifting.

item.content:encoded: NASA held a briefing ahead of Monday's Artemis I moon rocket test flight, on the role of industry in advancing human space exploration (Aug. 26)

item.title: Meet Clark, the 19-year-old bald eagle spotted traveling through airport security
item.description: Clark, a 19-year-old bald eagle, traveled through Charlotte Douglas International Airport on Monday, the Transportation Security Administration said.

item.dc:creator: Wyatte Grantham-Philips, USA TODAY
item.content:encoded: Clark, a 19-year-old bald eagle, traveled through Charlotte Douglas International Airport on Monday, the Transportation Security Administration said.

item.title: Analyst: Fed 'locked into' interest rate hikes
item.description: The Federal Reserve is "locked into" stark rate cuts in its fight against inflation, according to Ed Moya, a market analyst in New York. (Aug. 26)
item.author: AP Domestic
item.dc:creator: AP
item.content:encoded: The Federal Reserve is "locked into" stark rate cuts in its fight against inflation, according to Ed Moya, a market analyst in New York. (Aug. 26)

item.title: Migrants bypass AZ shipping container border wall
item.description: Patched gaps in the border wall by the state of Arizona are not deterring scores of asylum-seekers crossing the US-Mexico border daily near Yuma. The refugees are bypassing the shipping container fixes by passing through adjacent Indian tribal lands. (Aug. 26) (AP video by Eugene Garcia)
item.author: AP Domestic
item.dc:creator: AP
item.content:encoded: Patched gaps in the border wall by the state of Arizona are not deterring scores of asylum-seekers crossing the US-Mexico border daily near Yuma. The refugees are bypassing the shipping container fixes by passing through adjacent Indian tribal lands. (Aug. 26) (AP video by Eugene Garcia)

item.title: Along with forgiving student loan debt, Biden extends pause. When will payments start again?
item.description: If you end up being approved for federal loan forgiveness and still have a balance, you'd start payments on your leftover loansÂ in January 2023.
item.author: USA TODAY
item.dc:creator: Claire Thornton, USA TODAY
item.content:encoded: If you end up being approved for federal loan forgiveness and still have a balance, you'd start payments on your leftover loansÂ in January 2023.

item.title: T-Mobile and SpaceX promise end of dead zones
item.description: SpaceX and T-Mobile have announce what the companies are calling the end of "dead zones" for cell service; team up to cover remote areas. (Aug. 26).
item.author: AP Domestic
item.dc:creator: AP
item.content:encoded: SpaceX and T-Mobile have announce what the companies are calling the end of "dead zones" for cell service; team up to cover remote areas. (Aug. 26).

item.title: Black Alabama pastor says police unlawfully arrested him as he watered neighbor's flowers
item.description: Attorneys for Michael Jennings, an Alabama pastor who was arrested while watering his neighbors' flowers, released police footage and plan a lawsuit.
item.author: USA TODAY
item.dc:creator: Mike Snider, USA TODAY
item.content:encoded: Attorneys for Michael Jennings, an Alabama pastor who was arrested while watering his neighbors' flowers, released police footage and plan a lawsuit.

item.title: Mississippi's Pearl River floods homes, daycares and roads after heavy rains
item.description: Record-breaking rains are expected to flood the Pearl River as evacuations have already begun in Mississippi.
item.author: USA TODAY
item.dc:creator: Anthony Jackson, USA TODAY
item.content:encoded: Record-breaking rains are expected to flood the Pearl River as evacuations have already begun in Mississippi.

item.title: Fed Chair Powell delivers stark inflation message
item.description: Federal Reserve Chair Jerome Powell delivered a stark message Friday: The Fed will likely impose more large interest rate hikes in coming months and is resolutely focused on taming the highest inflation in four decades. (Aug. 26)
item.author: AP Domestic
item.dc:creator: AP
item.content:encoded: Federal Reserve Chair Jerome Powell delivered a stark message Friday: The Fed will likely impose more large interest rate hikes in coming months and is resolutely focused on taming the highest inflation in four decades. (Aug. 26)
